channel.title: cloudflare on JDHeyburn
channel.description: Recent content in cloudflare on JDHeyburn

item.title: Who Goes Blogging Pt. 1: Getting Started
item.description: I’ve done a lot of talking about how this website is currently, but let’s talk about how you can get set up with the same as I have done here. Let’s recap exactly what that is: A GitHub repo with the site source code Another GitHub project with the rendered site Hosted on GitHub Pages Fronted by a custom domain Globally cached by a CDN Redirecting multiple domains We’ll cover the first three points in this post, with the remainder to come in a follow up post.

item.title: Who Goes Blogging Pt. 0: Applying Cartography
item.description: Applying Cartography With my academic background focused in infrastructure, I love seeing diagrams of topologies - they’re a pretty damn useful way of understanding architecture of an application flow amongst other things. Let’s take a look at how my portfolio site is architected out. As I mentioned in my first blog post - I’ve got several ideas on how I can improve on the architecture of this site. But what good is evaluating where you’ve come from if you don’t document what you currently have?
